result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on November 10, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Absolute sobriety if operating a MV and must submit to testing if requested by law enforcement and no presence in bars/taverns/liquor stores not to operate any MV w/o valid DL and absolute sobriety at all times.
Telephone scheduling conference on October 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

2:46 PM Defendant Daniel W Cloyd appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Annie E Getsinger appeared by video for Daniel W Cloyd.  Attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and appearances.  DE does qualify for PD appt.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaints.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties in all three cases.  Atty Getsinger explains nonappearce by DE on 8/10/22 in 22CT147.  State makes bail argument - requests $1,000 cash in each felony and $150 cash in cm case.  Atty Getsinger responds - requests signature bonds or lesser cash bonds.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing in 22CF479 and 22CF480.  

22CT147 $50.00 cash bond set - Special bond conditions as follows: Not to operate a MV w/o a valid DL
22CF479 $200.00 cash bond set - Special bond conditions as follows: Absolute sobriety if operating a MV and must submit to testing if requested by law enforcement and no presence in bars/taverns/liquor stores not to operate any MV w/o valid DL and absolute sobriety at all times.
22CF480 $200.00 cash bond set - Special bond conditions as follows: Absolute sobriety if operating a MV and must submit to testing if requested by law enforcement and no presence in bars/taverns/liquor stores not to operate any MV w/o valid DL and absolute sobriety at all times.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Return date scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on November 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on September 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.
